Context:
The text is about a postgraduate program in Culinary Arts with a focus on Italian cuisine offered by George Brown College. The program involves studying in Italy and working in top restaurants and hotels. Students will receive individual attention, training, and inspiring experiences. Upon graduation, students are expected to be sought-after employees in the culinary industry due to the reputation of the program among Italian restaurateurs in Toronto and beyond.

Key Information:
- Program: Culinary Arts – Italian postgraduate program
- Location: George Brown College
- Study Destination: Italy
- Duration: The program duration is not explicitly mentioned in the text, but it is stated that some classes may run from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m., suggesting a full-time schedule.
- Required Courses (SEMESTER 1): HOSF 1150 - Italian Art and Culture: A Culinary Perspective, HOSF 1151 - Italian Language, HOSF 1152 - Fundamentals of Italian Cooking – Theory and Practical, HOSF 1153 - Dynamics of Italian Food and Wine, HOSF 1154 - Italian Pastry
- Career Opportunities: Italian restaurants in Toronto and beyond, with a focus on regional variations of Italian cuisine.

No factual entities such as years or numbers are mentioned in the text.

Context:
Program Offered: Italian Culinary Program
Semesters: Semester 3 and starting Fall 2023 for domestic students and Fall 2024 for international students
Courses:
- HOSF 1164: Italian Externship – Stage (12 weeks)
- HOSF 4016: Italian Culinary Cuisine Concepts
- HOSF 4018: Italian Product Knowledge
- HOSF 1170: The Slow Food Experience
- HOSF 1173: Integrated Marketing Management for Restaurant Operations
- HOSF 1174: Fundamentals of Italian Cooking II – Capstone Evaluation
Learning Outcomes:
- Create and implement an authentic Italian menu
- Converse in basic Italian and use correct Italian terminology
- Identify, assess and select appropriate food products for authentic Italian cuisine
- Integrate with Italian culture
- Prepare Italian cuisine within Canadian and EU health, safety and nutrition regulations
- Develop and present a marketing plan for a restaurant
Tuition & Fees:
Domestic Students:
- Estimated total of tuition, ancillary fees, student service and materials: $14,409.00 *
International Students:
- Estimated total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees: $35,340.00 **
Additional Costs:
- Uniform: $290
- Knives and small wares: $500–$700
- Black safety shoes

* Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates. This fee does not include books, which are to be purchased by the student separately.
** Tuition fees are subject to board approval. Material, student service and ancillary fees are estimated based on prior years. All fees are subject to change without notice. This fee does not include books, which are to be purchased by the student separately.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Culinary Arts – Italian Program (Postgraduate) H411 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Fees:
- Knives and small wares: $290
- Black safety shoes: $500–$700
- Airfare to Italy: $110–$160 (approximate)
- Visa and other associated fees: $1,400-$1,800 (approximate)
- Damage deposit for ALMA accommodation: €200 (refundable)
- Airport transfer (approximate): $300
- OSAP funding eligibility

Program Admission Requirements:
- Culinary management diploma or bachelor's degree and one year of relevant work experience OR
- One-year certificate from a culinary skills program or advanced cook certification and one year of relevant work experience OR
- Diploma or bachelor's degree in an unrelated field and one year of full-time relevant work experience

English Language Proficiency:
- International students with international transcripts who do not provide English language proficiency test results must test at the college level in the George Brown College English assessment to be considered for admission.

Country Specific Admission Requirements:
- International students should visit the International Admissions page for more information.

Special Requirements:
- Valid WHMIS and Sanitation certification prior to the start of the program. If not held, students are required to arrange completion of them at their own expense.
- Students should be aware that various allergens including nuts, dairy and shellfish are routinely used in practical labs.
- George Brown College is sensitive to religious observances but products purchased for production and consumption may not meet specific dietary laws related to halal and kosher foods.

Application:
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Culinary Arts – Italian Program (Postgraduate) H411 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
* George Brown College offers a Culinary Arts – Italian program (H411) for international students in partnership with ALMA Scuola di Cucina.
* The program includes a four-month externship in Italy during the second semester.
* International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
* For inquiries about financial aid, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid web page.
* Contact the Admissions Office for domestic admission-related inquiries at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions web page.
* For more information about George Brown College, contact the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.
* International students can contact one of the international recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin through booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.
* Visit the campus for Discovery Day to learn more about areas of interest, get a first-hand look at facilities, and meet with representatives. Sign up for Open House Discovery Day and explore related programs like Culinary Management (H100), Culinary Skills (H134), and Advanced French Patisserie (Postgraduate) (H413).
* Sonya Franceschini was drawn to the Culinary Arts – Italian program due to its exclusive partnership with ALMA Scuola di Cucina and the four-month externship in Italy.
* The classes are small and well organized, creating a highly professional atmosphere.
